cellularAutomata.util
Class ToolTipComboBox

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent

                  cellularAutomata.util.ToolTipComboBox
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.ItemSelectable, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.event.ListDataListener
Direct Known Subclasses:
ToolTipLatticeComboBox
public abstract class ToolTipComboBox
extends javax.swing.JComboBox

Creates a combo box that uses a tool tip. Child classes must specify the tooltip that will be used for each element of the list displayed in the combo box. See ToolTipRuleComboBox as an example.

Author:
David Bahr
See Also:
Serialized Form

getToolTipText

public java.lang.String getToolTipText(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
Overrides the getToolTip from JComponent so that the tool tip depends on the selected item. This simple solution works very well on pcs, but this does not work on a Mac. Grrr. So the custom renderer is used below for Macs. Should not need the custom renderer. Should only need this overridden method. However, using a custom renderer does allow the tooltip to appear while the list items are being scrolled -- that is nice!

Overrides:
getToolTipText in class javax.swing.JComponent
Returns:
The tool tip.

isSelectedItemEnabled

public boolean isSelectedItemEnabled()
True if the selected item is enabled.

Returns:
true if the selected item is enabled.

setEnabled

public void setEnabled(java.lang.Object item,
                       boolean enable)
Enables or disables the item if it exists. The item can still be selected, but it is colored grey.

Parameters:
item - The list item that will be enabled or disabled.
enable - Whether or not to enable (true) or disable (false).

setItemColored

public void setItemColored(java.lang.Object item,
                           java.awt.Color color)
Sets a list of combo box items that will be painted a special color. Calling this method multiple times will set multiple items.

Parameters:
item - The combo box item that will be colored.
color - The color that the item will be painted. May be null which will use a default color.
